body.p:
Office of H. R. Littell
County Judge of Christian County
Hopkinsville Ky
To his Excellency
James F Robintson
Governor of Kentucky

As Judge of the Christian County Court I certify that John Litchfield late of Christian County Ky ruthlessly & without cause or provocation shot stabed & murdered in this County John Cotton on Thursday the 25 day of June 1863 & is now running at large in the community Said John Litchfield has also threatened to kill several other good citizens in the same neighborhood From representations made to me & from my own knowledge, I have no hesitation in saying that said Litchfield is a very reckless dangerous man & it is quite likely will if not arrested carry his threats into execution A Large number or at least a great many of the citizens of that portion of the county for several days past have quit their regular avocations & kept up a general search for him It is confidently belived that he is yet in the County He is a diserter from the 17th Ky Vols & a complete outlaw. It is the desire of this community that you offer a reward of from $250,00 to $500, for his apprehension It is believed he is harboured by persons who for the reward would betray him Given under my hand this July 2 1863
